message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.RO, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with computer vision and graphics, specifically with estimating 3D human motion and body shape from monocular video. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves regularization functions to enhance robustness over time, which falls under the sub-category of cs.GR (Graphics). The use of flow to find temporally coherent human poses of a motion sequence suggests the involvement of robotics, making cs.RO (Robotics) another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of an artificial flow renderer, which falls under the sub-category of cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the use of optimization techniques to estimate human motion suggests the involvement of machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category as well.
